paper_abstract: A bipartite graph G = (U, V, E) is a chain graph [M. Yannakakis, Computing the minimum fill-in is NP-complete. SIAM J. Algebraic Discrete Methods 2 (1) (1981) 77-79] if there is a bijection pi : {1,..., vertical bar U vertical bar} -> U such that Gamma-(pi(1)) superset of Gamma(pi(2)) superset of ... superset of Gamma(pi(vertical bar U vertical bar)), where Gamma is a function that maps a node to its neighbors. We give approximation algorithms for two variants of the MINIMUM CHAIN COMPLETION problem, where we are given a bipartite graph G(U, V, E), and the goal is find the minimum set of edges F that need to be added to G such that the bipartite graph G' = (U, V, E') (E' = E boolean OR F) is a chain graph. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Approximating the Minimum Chain Completion problem
